data.title: Typing a closing curly brace in my code indents it
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insider - OS Version: Windows 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open any JSX file 2. Type: ```jsx render() {
} ``` then, put cursor just after `'vs'`, and type another curly brace (`}`). Instant indentation which is not expected. ![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/760112/21450747/8e962148-c91f-11e6-870d-6752d358e17c.gif)

data.title: Integration Tests of an extension test are failing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: vscode@1.0.3
- OS Version: 10.12.3 and Ubuntu 12.04.5 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. npm install && npm run vscode:prepublish

npm@3.10.9
node@v6.9.2
nvm@0.32.0

Repo: https://github.com/mohseenrm/lit-it
Travis: https://travis-ci.org/mohseenrm/lit-it/jobs/186272789

Issue: 
Tests run locally and pass. Same error on local machine though (mentioned MAC OS).
`npm ERR! Failed at the lit-it@1.2.10 vscode:prepublish script 'node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/compile'.`
[Travis Raw Log](https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/186272789/log.txt)

data.title: PHP 7.X.X SUPPORT
[Feature Request] The command palette doesn't support Ctrl-n/Ctrl-p key binding for navigation.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

I love the Emacs keybindings on macOS, and the Ctrl-n/p for going up/down works almost everywhere on Mac, however the VSCode command palette doesn't support it, so everytime I have to use that tiny up/down keys to choose, which is quite inconvenient.
Please add this tiny feature and I will love VSCode much more! :1st_place_medal: 
Cheers!

data.title: #14464 Preserve editor size when switching layout
data.body:
Implementation of #14464 

Currently when switching from horizontal to vertical editor layout (or vice-versa), the layout is reset to all editors being evenly sized. We would like it if the editors maintained their relative size when switching layouts.

Additionally, the minimized state of any editors should be preserved so that editors that were minimized in one layout are still minimized after switching.

data.title: How to inspect Command Palette?
data.body:
I want to use developer tools to inspect command palette view, however when I inspect the element in command palette and try expanding the elements in developer tool, the command palette would dismiss (obviously it's due to losing focus) causing the element html become cleared.

So what's right way to do that? Thanks!

data.title: How to debug vscode with specific language configuration?
data.body:
I'm trying debugging a localized version of vscode built by myself. When I click `Launch VS Code` or use `scripts\code --remote-debugging-port=9222`, a instance of built vscode will be launched. However, its locale is `en` and even if I run `configure language` and change the `locale` to other values, it's still `en` after restarted.

Could someone point me to the right way? Thanks!

data.title: Fix #15343 - Add `git commit --amend`

data.title: Intra-document links in extension Readme are broken.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Find an extension that uses intra-document links in its Readme (e.g. 'vscode-lldb').
2. Click on one such link.

Instead of taking you to the link destination, VSCode displays HTML source of "webview.html".

-----

Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-vsce/issues/118

1. Open SideBar
2. Press keyboard shortcut "shift+cmd+e", nothing happens

4. Press keyboard shortcut "shift+cmd+e", nothing happens

data.title: Check if terminal cwd exists and is directory
data.body: Fixes #17450

data.title: Fix #17750 - Implement "revert selected lines"
data.body: Reverts the selected lines in the diff editor, similar operation to "stage selected lines". If only part of a change is selected, only the selected lines are reverted. 'cmd+z' will undo the revert.

data.title: Diff editor "revert selected lines"
data.body:
There's probably already a feature request for this but I can't find it.

I want to be able to select a change in the diff editor and revert it, same as how I can stage it. In SourceTree this is called "discard selected lines" although "revert" seems better, unless it's "discard selected changes".

I'm working on a PR for this.

data.title: Save Dialogues Show Up Before Editor Switch
Add Git Autocomplete to terminal
data.body: Pressing tab to autocomplete works for terminal commands like `cd` etc, but not for git commands (or git branches). This would be a great addition to VS code.

data.title: Scrolling issues with precision touchpad.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open file from a VS project.
2. Scrolling of file is very jittery.

Steps to resolve:
1. Resize window by any means full screen using maximize button or just resize using corner dragging and it works fine.

data.title: Auto Complete doesn't suggest snippets with TM_SELECTED_TEXT when selecting text.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Add this snippet:
    "SurroundTest": {
        "prefix": "SurroundTest",
        "body": [
            "SurroundTest( ${TM_SELECTED_TEXT})"
        ],
        "description": "."
    }

2. Try to surround a word with ctrl+space:

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write `.test(a=`
2. Press <kbd>'</kbd> or <kbd>"</kbd>

Quotes will be closed.

### Actual behaviour

Quotes not closed.

![2016-12-22_23-19-56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/21439109/30c76568-c89d-11e6-9388-6a5a588c3db6.gif)

data.title: Save new file without extension fails
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607 OS Build 14393.576) (as up-to-date as is reasonable)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a new file
2. go to save dialog
3. change the `Save as type:` to `All Files (*.*)` and ensure that the name has no extension following it
4. click save
Results in "the file name is not valid" error.

Desired behavior is that you will be allowed to save the file without an extension in the first pass instead of rename workaround.
Workaround: However, VSCode does allow you to rename a file to a no-extension name. If you proceed after the above error and name the file Untitled-1.txt or any other extension, you can then use the right-click -> rename dialog to remove the extension and it will behave as otherwise expected. 

What other details can I capture to help with this? I'm not a dev, but work around code and sometimes debug, so I can be given technical instructions 😄 I did not see anything in dev tools that appeared to capture the save file work flow and error state, but that was also my first time looking through there. 

Thanks for the great editor and great community of extension writers!

data.title: alt+click on directory should recursively collapse directories
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open several directories within a project
2. alt+click on parent does not collapse them all


I know this is a minor issue, but it is very difficult to navigate larger projects with all directories displaying as open.

2. Scroll file up and down or try to fold code.

data.title: vim stops working
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.8.1
- OS Version:osx 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I have installed different versions of the vim plugin vim and amvim
2. I use the command line to open vim , i,e, code .
3. After interacting with a file, and typically moving around the file using the h, j, k, and l keys the editor no longer allows me to edit.  I can still move around using the arrow keys, but I can no longer enter text in the edit pane, or in the sidebar, i.e. extensions.  I always have to kill code to get it working again.  This behavior is inconsistent, at first it was happening all the time, then it didn't happen for a couple of days, now it is happening all the time again.

data.title: Code Helper is spiking to 100% CPU usage
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.8.1 - OS Version: macOS Sierra This happened a couple of times today. I always kill them and restart VS Code. After a while they are coming back. Couldn't find an issue yet but noticed on twitter that some people experience the same issue.

data.title: Handle errors from debug adapter when fetching sources
Vertically split code editor and integrated terminal
data.body: Feature request for the ability to split the code editor and the integrated terminal vertically so that they are side-by-side.

data.title: Opening command palette doesn't work when go to file palette is open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insiders
- OS Version: mac 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open vscode
2. open go to file palette with `cmd+p`
3. type `cmd+shift+p` to open the command palette 
4. *expect* opens command pallete
5. *err* opens the last file in the go-to file palette

data.title: Don't Show TSC Version Warning When Editing JS Files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1 (November Recovery)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write javascript (not TS, just vanilla JS) for a random period of time.
2. Save your work occasionally.
3. Watch the error info with amusement.

I have been coding for like a full workday now and I just got an error stating the following:

![vscd](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9406520/21431026/5793a334-c86e-11e6-80db-1c93cd971bb3.PNG)

And when I click the more information link, it routes me to [this section of the TypeScript information](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/typescript#_using-newer-typescript-versions):

I went on and updated my typescript version using **```npm install -g typescript@latest```** , I presume this the issue.

data.title: Word wrap only in Markdown files
data.body: When I write my code, I want word wrapping to be disabled. When I write Markdown, I’d like to configure word wrapping at 80 characters. Is there a way to create different editor configurations for different file types?
